column5: Great advise Joe. Remember,your there to work,not to chat. That time will come later.
Good job!  I made it into the company I work for through a temp. agency as well, unforunately.
Good going......keep your head on straight and push ahead.....fishing will come later....
Good for you Mike now buy a boat with 200hp Tiller

Yup  500+ hours on probation...  Then another raise...  I don't plan on letting up anytime soon... This job is great... It's very physical so it's a good workout... I've lost like 30 pounds in 2 months...  And there's room to grow within this company... It's HUGE... So I have to keep going like I'm always on probation so I can try to move up the ladder... And get experience that can help me in the future if something should come up...

Just got the call saying i made the cut to move from the temp agency I'm currently working for to the company that contracts them...  I get a big raise.... And benifits for my family...  I will now be employed by the biggest and best logistics company in the WORLD wich has plenty of opertunity to grow as an employee...   I'm sooooo happy right now....
Right on, always good to hear people landing decent jobs. Nothing is worse than an unemployed leach.

My mrs,s was doing the same thing.Even though she had to have surgery,they still kept her on.  Good on ya Mike.  Sad really,that many have to go to these temp places.Guess if they keep you for a year or so,they know your a good worker.
That's great news Mike.!  Good job man
:thumbsup_anim:  Benefits are going to be a huge...benefit...for a growing family. This will also make your time on the water, more meaningful. Congratulations !
Great stuff Mike, you must have made quite an impression on them !!
Good to hear!!!,all the best!

Glad for you and your family that you were taken on and off the temp. position. It shows that you are a hard worker and worthy of your new companies commitment to you. Ther are too many people who would have claimed a disability and not gone to the temp agency. Once again congratulations!
CONGRATS!!!!
Thanks everyone...  This is an amazing opertunity and we are very happy...
Good for you- congratulations!!!!!!
Right on bro!!! You the man!
great job Mike them benefits are a huge help with a young family.
congratz on the job mike!
good to hear
Congrats!
Good for you Mike. Hope you make the best of it.
They made a great choice in you Mike. Show em what you got Bud !!!! Big congrats to ya.Hope you and Marissa are gonna celibrate
congrats musky Mike
WTG Mike!! make sure that it does not get in the way of fishing eh?!!!
Congradulations!!!!. It sucks to be un-employeed.. Hope they treat you well
Great news, Mike, congrats!  You might have to take a fishing trip to celebrate.  :-)

Just remember Mike, you are now beginning the 3 month probation period with your new employer... most companies will not give you credit for time served while being employed by a third party. Keep yer head down, continue to work to the level they have seen and now expect and good luck to you; congrats to your family. HH
Congratulations Mike, that's some great news for you and your family.  Maureen
